page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF HESKETH BANK
page.content: With the area being mainly reclaimed land, the land surveyed is extremely flat. The only notable exceptions to the north of Shore Road are the two large banks, built to help reclaim the land. To the south of Shore Road the land begins to rise quite gradually. As would be expected the reclaimed land is covered by a network of drainage ditches which help to keep the land usable for farming crops and animals. The only residential area consists of a council housing estate and a newer private housing estate. Neither of these estates have any ammenities. These houses do not have any gas piped in, as the Gas Board have not yet piped gas into the village. The only public transport runs buses between Southport and Preston.
